data.title: Alumni Awards & Recognition
data.text:
Alumni Achievement Awards

Each year, UD alumni are recognized for their achievements in their communities or while on campus at the University of Dubuque. Nominations can be submitted by a University of Dubuque alumna/us or by a member of the campus community. Nominations can be made year round using the nomination form at the top of the page. Awards are presented during the Homecoming Awards and Recognition Bruch each fall. There are six award categories, descriptions and criteria for each award is listed below.

Alumnus/Alumna of Distinction Award

Awarded to a graduate or friend of the University who has distinguished himself/herself in service to the whole church and/or the world; has characterized or exemplified the academic, physical, and spiritual growth we hold as goals in life of a University of Dubuque student; and has displayed loyalty and interested concern for the University of Dubuque and its future.

Veterans Award for Distinguished Service

Awarded to an alumnus or alumna veteran who has made a positive impact on their local, national, international or veteran community, the University, or through their military service. To be eligible, the nominee must be a person who served in the military and who received an Honorable Discharge. In general, includes someone that served as a member of the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, Coast Guard and the equivalent reserve component or as a commissioned officer of the Public Health Service, the Environmental Science Services Administration or the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. When submitting the nomination for this award, please reference the dates of service and rank of the nominee for this recognition.

Seminary - Manning Award

Awarded since 1972, the Herbert E. Manning, Jr. Distinctive Service Awards recognize UDTS alumni/alumnae who demonstrate exceptional contributions in Christian ministry. Recipients model servant leadership, courageous convictions, a spirit of witness, and a faithful obedience as they contribute significantly to the Church universal, the Seminary, and all of God's people.

Criteria

The awards recognize the many gifts of one spirit, in a person who:

Graduated with a professional degree (MAR, MDiv, DMin) from UDTS

In ministry leaves a lasting legacy impacting the lives of others

Is in a ministry supportive of or identified with a church or a church body

Without concern for self is witnessing to others with a true sense of call in a specific time and place

Demonstrates an appreciative relationship with UDTS and/or the Alumni Association

Contributes to the nominee's denomination and/or the wider church

Qualifies for an award category, which currently include Parish Ministry and Specialized Ministry, including mission, ecumenism, community service, chaplaincy, communications, education, etc.

Has served seven years in the ministry; nominees need not be ordained

The University of Dubuque Alumni Association established the Alumni Athletic Hall of Fame in 1989 as a permanent place to honor those individuals who have promoted and served the University through its athletic programs.

The Athletic Hall of Fame recognizes former student-athletes, coaches, and supporters who have contributed to the success of the University of Dubuque.

Athletic Hall of Fame

The Athletic Hall of Fame has honored a select number of former athletes for their outstanding individual contributions to the University's athletic programs. As well, a prestigious award has been presented to a team of past athletes who together are recognized for their contributions in athletics.

CRITERIA FOR THE HALL OF FAME INDIVIDUAL AWARD INCLUDE:

Out of the University for at least seven years.

Lettered in a varsity sport at UD.

Made an outstanding contribution to the stature of the University's athletic program and to the ideals of community life at UD.

Shows continuous support of UD.

CRITERIA FOR THE HALL OF FAME TEAM AWARD INCLUDE:

Must have won a conference championship and/or were invited for NCAA post-season play.

Must be at least 10 years since that accomplishment.

Athletic Hall of Distinction

The Hall of Distinction is awarded to other supporters of UD's athletic programs and is designed to recognize those individuals who have given unselfishly to further the University's athletic programs in support of athletes.

CRITERIA FOR THE HALL OF DISTINCTION AWARD INCLUDE:

Made a significant contribution to UD as an administrator, member of the athletic support staff, coach, and/or booster alumnus/alumna.

Out of the University at least seven years.

Made an outstanding contribution to the stature of the University's athletic program and to the ideals of community life at UD.

Demonstrated significant lifelong contributions to society, community, or athletics through service and leadership.

Solomon Butler Character and Courage Award

In May 2014, the Solomon Butler Character and Courage Award was introduced by Dan Runkle, then director of intercollegiate athletics. The award developed from a discussion regarding alumni who have been nominated for the Athletic Hall of Fame, but who do not meet the full criteria to be inducted into the Hall of Fame. However, sometimes these alumni have wonderful character/courage traits accompanying their athletic history. This award recognizes those individuals.

Jerry Petitgoue Award

The Jerry Petitgoue Award is named after University of Dubuque alumnus Jerry Petitgoue (C'63). This award was established in 2012 to honor an alumnus coach who best represents Petitgoue's tenacity, strong work ethic, and care for athletes of any age, at any level.
